title: Con Dowdall
text:
Con Dowdall (born 1945) is an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> retired <a href="hurling">hurler</a> who played as a right wing-forward for the <a href="Wexford%20GAA">Wexford</a> senior team.
Born in <a href="Wexford">Wexford</a>, Dowdall first arrived on the inter-county scene at the age of seventeen two when he first linked up with the Wexford minor team, before later joining the under-21 side. He made his senior debut during the <a href="1965%20All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">1965 championship</a>. Dowdall went on to play a bit part for Wexford over the next few years and won one <a href="Leinster%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">Leinster</a> medal.
At club level Dowdall won two <a href="Wexford%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">championship</a> medals with <a href="Faythe%20Harriers">Faythe Harriers</a>.
Throughout his inter-county career, Dowdall made just 4 championship appearances for Wexford. His retirement came following the conclusion of the <a href="1971%20All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">1971 championship</a>.
His brother-in-law, <a href="Liam%20Bennett">Liam Bennett</a>, also played with Wexford.
